intro: Capnoides dasyptera, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark blue or purple color, containing several seeds. Capnoides dasyptera is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils and agricultural areas.
